original_table_html:
Some of the largest research services firms have large international organizations. Nielsen has offices in more than 100 countries.
Nielsen Pop Quiz #19
HOW MANY COUNTRIES DOES IT TAKE TO BE THE WORLD'S LEADING GLOBAL INFORMATION COMPANY?

WANT THE ANSWER? JUST ASK NIELSEN.

We know you’ve heard all the work trying to evangelize the global economy. You’ve got a company to run, or a division to overhaul, or a new product to launch, or an old product to revamp. You need information and insight that will help your business perform more successfully, whether it’s in your backyard or the Kingdom of Bhutan.

That’s why Nielsen can help.

From launching a new energy drink to introducing a social networking site to sponsoring the best location for the next smoothie shop, Nielsen works with Fortune 100 companies, start-ups and every size in between to provide continuous understanding on issues that help shape the future. Faith working, listening, reading, watching, blogging, eating, recycling, playing, texting, and (occasionally) sleeping.

So if you’re looking for a partner to cover broad swaths of the marketplace — or a single consumer in Dallas, Dakar or Delhi — Nielsen is here. There. And everywhere.

more questions? justasknielsen.com
Country Number of Offices
A11
B15
C28
D167
E102
summary_markdown: The provided information highlights Nielsen's extensive global presence as a leading information company. It details Nielsen's operations across numerous countries, emphasizing their capability to provide market insights regardless of geographical scope, from local markets to international regions. The accompanying table illustrates this reach, showing a progression in the number of offices Nielsen maintains in different countries, ranging from a single office in country A1 to 102 offices in country E. This structure suggests a comparative analysis of Nielsen's office distribution, underscoring their commitment to serving a diverse clientele, including Fortune 100 companies and startups, with continuous market understanding.
